decks.notes: The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to play powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field. It aims to either play Primeval Titan or use cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith to find key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva for a devastating combo finish. By utilizing the synergy between lands and creatures, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and win the game in a single powerful turn.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By utilizing powerful cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, you can apply pressure on your opponent early in the game. Utilizing cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment allows you to control the board and deal additional damage to your opponent. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Voice of Victory provides additional support and disruption to your opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana for your spells.

This deck focuses on assembling a combo involving Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to generate massive amounts of +1/+1 counters. Glaring Fleshraker helps to control the board while Writhing Chrysalis provides additional creatures to enhance the combo. The deck includes powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista. Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble serve as disruption spells, while Urza's Saga helps to find key combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a massive army of pumped up creatures using unique interactions and powerful synergies.

This deck revolves around quickly equipping Colossus Hammer to creatures like Puresteel Paladin and Cori-Steel Cutter to deal massive damage and win the game in a single turn. It uses cards like Stoneforge Mystic, Steelshaper's Gift, and Urza's Saga to tutor for equipment and combo pieces efficiently. Esper Sentinel helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal provide card advantage and ramp. The deck also includes removal and protection spells like Portable Hole and Sigarda's Aid to ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

This deck utilizes a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game while applying constant pressure to the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from stabilizing while closing out the game quickly with powerful finishers like Solitude and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. Additionally, cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate provide additional utility and flexibility in dealing with opposing threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour, then bring them back to the battlefield using spells like Unearth and Persist. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game while setting up your combo. This combo-reanimator strategy aims to overwhelm your opponent with large, hard-to-deal-with creatures early in the game.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour. Then, the deck uses cards like Unearth and Persist to bring those creatures back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo reanimation play. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game and protect the combo. The mana base is built to support all the colors needed for the spells and creatures in the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply early pressure on the opponent. It also utilizes cheap instants and sorceries like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and deal direct damage. The deck aims to win quickly by overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also utilizing cantrips like Preordain and Mishra's Bauble to maintain card advantage and consistency. The key strategy is to be fast and relentless, putting the opponent on the back foot from the start of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and lands that can generate multiple mana to quickly ramp into big threats like Springheart Nantuko and Cultivator Colossus. It also includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to generate additional value. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and explosive plays, while also having access to tools like Green Sun's Zenith and Summoner's Pact to find key pieces when needed.

This Amulet Titan combo deck focuses on ramping up quickly with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to play Primeval Titan and search for key lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. The deck aims to generate a lot of mana, play Scapeshift to find lands, and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and combo pieces. The inclusion of specific lands like The Mycosynth Gardens and Hanweir Battlements adds versatility and utility to the deck, allowing for different strategic options depending on the matchup.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures, controlling the board with various removal and disruption spells. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Nulldrifter while also utilizing cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Return for additional value. The deck also features a mix of mana acceleration, card draw, and utility lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in various matchups.

The deck focuses on aggressive early game plays alongside disruptive elements to control the opponent's resources. By utilizing creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Psychic Frog, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp help to generate additional value from enter-the-battlefield effects, providing the deck with both tempo and card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Relic of Progenitus and Witch Enchanter further disrupt the opponent's strategy, making it a versatile and well-rounded aggro-control deck.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using cards that do not require any lands to function. By utilizing cards like Goblin Charbelcher, Lotus Bloom, and Whir of Invention, the deck aims to quickly set up a winning board state. Cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Hydroelectric Specimen help to control the opponent's board while Fallaji Archaeologist and Tameshi, Reality Architect provide consistency and card advantage. The deck also includes disruption spells like Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare to protect the combo and maintain tempo.

The deck revolves around filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, then using spells like Unearth and Persist to bring them back into play for a game-winning combo. Using a range of cheap spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's board and disrupt their strategy, the deck aims to quickly reanimate powerful threats and overwhelm the opponent with sheer value and efficiency. The mana base is designed to support a variety of color requirements for the deck's spells while also enabling easy access to the graveyard and key combo pieces.

The main goal of this deck is to use fast mana-generating spells like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual, along with cards like Ruby Medallion and Manamorphose, to ramp into powerful combo pieces like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse help to dig through the deck quickly to find key pieces, while Wrenn's Resolve and Artist's Talent provide additional support and control. The deck runs a mix of fetch lands and utility lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in its mana base, allowing for explosive turns and potent combos.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by using powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting your opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly to cast big threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. By utilizing powerful threats and disruption spells, the deck aims to out-resource and out-value the opponent to secure victory.
